裝.definition: adornment; to adorn; dress; clothing; costume (of an actor in a play); to play a role; to pretend; to install; to fix; to wrap (sth in a bag); to load; to pack

裝B.definition: variant of 裝屄|装屄[zhuang1 bi1]

裝作.definition: to pretend; to feign; to act a part

裝修.definition: to decorate; interior decoration; to fit up; to renovate

裝傻.definition: to act stupid; to pretend to be naive

裝卸.definition: to load or unload; to transfer; to assemble and disassemble

裝可愛.definition: to act cute; putting on adorable airs; to pretend to be lovely

裝嫩.definition: to act young; to affect a youthful appearance

裝屄.definition: to act like a pretentious prick

裝幀.definition: binding and layout (of a book etc)

裝彈.definition: to charge (ammunition into gun); to load

裝扮.definition: to decorate; to adorn; to dress up; to disguise oneself

裝料.definition: to load; to charge; to feed (esp. a machine)

裝模作樣.definition: (idiom) to put on an act; to show affectation; to indulge in histrionics

裝潢.definition: to mount (a picture); to dress; to adorn; decoration; packaging

裝璜.definition: variant of 裝潢|装潢[zhuang1 huang2]

裝瘋賣傻.definition: to play the fool (idiom); to feign madness

裝神弄鬼.definition: lit. to pretend to be in contact with supernatural beings (idiom); fig. to create a false sense of mystery; to play tricks to deceive or scare others; to engage in hocus-pocus

裝窮叫苦.definition: to feign and complain bitterly of being poverty stricken (idiom)

裝置.definition: to install; installation; equipment; system; unit; device

裝船.definition: to load cargo onto a ship

裝蒜.definition: to act stupid; to play dumb; to pretend to not know

裝袋.definition: to bag; to fill (a bag); bagging

裝設.definition: to install; to fit (e.g. a light bulb)

裝貨.definition: to load sth onto a ship etc

裝逼.definition: variant of 裝屄|装屄[zhuang1 bi1]

裝門面.definition: see 裝點門面|装点门面[zhuang1 dian3 men2 mian4]

裝點.definition: to decorate; to dress up; to deck

裝點門面.definition: lit. to decorate the front of one's store (idiom); fig. to embellish (one's CV, etc); to keep up appearances; to put up a front
